name: Azgol: Lair of the Ashen Idol

cards.rules_text:
Defender
[i]Lorecraft[/i] — As long as you control three or more enchantments, this creature can attack as though it didn't have defender.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Ancient sentinels animated by the will of the Ashen Idol guard the gates that encircle Ix'Naar.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Permanents enter the battlefield tapped this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Only a fool fails to kneel before his superiors.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{3}{B}: Monstrosity 2. [i](If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)[/i]
This creature has menace as long as it is monstrous.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has first strike.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Instead of burning, those who bathe in magma after receiving the Girathan blessing are transformed into the perfect warrior to serve the Ashen Idol.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When this creature enters, destroy up to one target creature that was dealt damage this turn.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature becomes a Spirit in addition to its other types.

[i]Lorecraft[/i] — You may cast this spell as though its had flash if you control three or more enchantments.
Deathtouch, reach
cards.flavor_text: [i]Unlike most of their kind on other planes, spiders on Azgol are completely blind. They build pits for their prey to fall into. Like other spiders, an easy meal for them is one that can't run away.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever another creature you control enters, you gain 1 life. If that creature is a mage, each opponent loses 1 life. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Many sought the protections provided by cities; Working as civil servants by day and perfecting their craft by night.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you attack, target Warrior you control gains deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.

{T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
Whenever a creature you control becomes monstrous, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Organic matter and beings from beyond merge with amalgamated harmony.[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of combat during each opponent's turn, tap up to one target creature that player controls.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Those cursed by the Ashen Idol wear masks to obscure their wretched visage. Only in times of war do they display their abominable appearance.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The tar pooled at the foothills of Ix'Naar makes a potent poison that can staunch bloodflow on contact with the vein.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this creature enters, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit enchantment creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The rest of her family were stripped of their arcane powers by the Ashen Idol. Now she searches for others who would wield magic against tyrants.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever this creature enters or attacks, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

{2}{R}: Monstrosity 1 [i](If this creature isn't monstrous, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes monstrous.)[/i]
When this creature becomes monstrous during your main phase, gain control of target creature an opponent controls until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
Untap up to two target creatures. If they have different controllers, you may have them fight. [i](Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Burlau can't be domesticated only dominated. Those who kill their packmates instate themselves as their replacement.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Trample
The Ashen Idol gets +6/+6 for each opponent.
Whenever The Ashen Idol deals combat damage to a player, that player discards six cards.

When this enchantment enters, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all creature cards revealed this way into your hand, then shuffle.
Whenever one or more counters are placed on a creature you control, that creature gains trample until end of turn.

Flying
At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, tap up to one target creature that player controls.
cards.flavor_text: [i]A guiding light for it's allies and a blinding light for it's enemies.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever one or more enchantments you control enter, surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)[/i]
Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn if it's monstrous. Then that creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
[i]Lorecraft[/i] — When this creature enters, you gain 2 life. If you control three or more enchantments, you gain that much life instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Rise up you; the common people enslaved by lies. A lie that your god has ever had your best interests at heart.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vigilance
[i]Lorecraft[/i] — Whenever this creature attacks, if you control three or more enchantments, tap up to one target creature.
{0}: Prevent all damage that a source of your choice would deal to this creature this turn. Activate only once. [i](This ability can't be activated again.)[/i]
Destroy target attacking creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Stand ready and let our foes impale themselves if that is what they wish.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When this creature enters, destroy target attacking creature if its power is less than or equal to the number different types of mages you control or if you control at least one of each type of mage. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]
Whenever one or more nontoken enchantments you control enter, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit enchantment creature token.

Strain [i](As an additional cost to cast this spell you may have all lands that produced mana to cast it not untap during your next untap step.)[/i]
When this creature enters, if it is strained, exile up to one target creature. Return that creature to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
{1}{W}: Return this creature and each Aura you own attached to it to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Kirin are the original inhabitants of Azgol. They have a connection to the spirit realm that mortals have tried to emulate for millenia.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this creature leaves the battlefield, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit enchantment creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]There is a theory claiming that the light of Azgol's star is somehow connected to the Spirit realm.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Lifelink
When this creature enters, you gain life equal to twice the number of different types of mages you control. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]

Strain [i](As an additional cost to cast this spell you may have all lands that produced mana to cast it not untap during your next untap step.)[/i]
Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn. If this spell is strained, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. [i](Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)[/i]

Strain [i](As an additional cost to cast this spell you may have all lands that produced mana to cast it not untap during your next untap step.)[/i]
Exile target creature. Return that creature to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step unless this spell is strained.

{T}: Tap target creature if its mana value is less than or equal to the number of different types of mages you control or you control at least one of each type of mage. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]

Whenever an Aura you control becomes attached to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, surveil 1. [i](Look at the top card of your library. You may put it into your graveyard.)[/i]
When this creature dies, put up to one target Curse card from your graveyard on top of your library.
[i]Lorecraft[/i] — When this creature enters, draw a card. Then discard a card unless you control three or more enchantments.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Whenever she tries to envision her own future, she sees premonitions of doom for all who surround her.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
Whenever this creature attacks, defending player mills X cards, where X is the number of Auras you control attached to them and/or permanents they control
cards.flavor_text: [i]Flues of mana froth from the peak of Ix'Naar. Monsters of the physical and spiritual planes both feast on this mystical energy.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
Whenever a creature you control that entered this turn blocks, put a stun counter on each creature blocked this way.
Surveil X, where X is the number of different types of mages you control. Then draw two cards. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]There are a myriad of sources from which to draw mana. Together we wield the sum power of this realm.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. That creature's controller discards a card unless they pay {1}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Such is the summoner's art of corporealization. I specialize in the opposite.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]In a world of monsters, fight or flight can also be rather monstrous.[/i]

cards.rules_text: This creature has lifelink as long as it's attacking.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Some are not able to undergo the process needed to be reborn in the image of their god. Their flesh instead tainted by the very earth that they wished to transcend.[/i]

I — Add one mana of any color.
II — Scry 2.
III — Until end of turn, if a creature or land entering the battlefield causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

Fable [i](You may trigger the chapters of this saga in any order. You choose which chapter to use as you place lore counters on it.)[/i]
I — Create a colorless 1/1 Spirit enchantment creature token.
II — Put two +1/+1 counters on up to one target creature you control.
III — Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls.

cards.rules_text:
Flash, Strain
Flying
When this creature enters, target creature you control gains indestructible until end of turn. If this spell is strained, instead creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

Enchantments you control have ward {1}.
Whenever an enchantment you control enters, draw a card.

Whenever an activated ability, triggered ability, instant spell, or sorcery spell changes the power or toughness of a creature an opponent controls, exile that creature.
{4}: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.special_text:
Fable [i](You may trigger the chapters of this saga in any order. You choose which chapter to use as you place lore counters on it.)[/i]
I — Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest.
II — Each player chooses a number of cards in their hand equal to the number of cards in the hand of the player with the fewest cards in their hand, then discards the rest.
III — Each player chooses a number of creatures they control equal to the number of creatures controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.rules_text: Return target creature from your graveyard to the battlefield. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Many believe that Janus was made to protect civilization. In reality, Janus decides those souls that can move from life to afterlife and who will be eternally tethered to their origins.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Strain
Choose one. If this spell is strained, choose both instead—
• Your life total becomes equal to the greatest among players.
• Double your life total.

This creature is also a Druid, Shaman, Warlock, and Wizard.
{T}: Look at the top card of your library. If that card shares a creature type with this creature, you may reveal it and put into your hand. Otherwise, put that card on the bottom of your library.
Gain control of target artifact or enchantment. If that permanent is an Aura or Equipment, you may attach it to a permanent or player it could enchant or equip.

You may cast spells from your hand as though they had flash.
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, the next spell that player casts this turn costs {1} more to cast.

cards.special_text:
Fable [i](You may trigger the chapters of this saga in any order. You choose which chapter to use as you place lore counters on it.)[/i]
I — Return up to one target creature to its owner's hand.
II — Return up to one target planeswalker to its owner's hand.
III — Exile this Saga. You may cast it from exile during your next turn.

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your end step, you may exile this enchantment, then return it to the battlefield under your control as a copy of another enchantment you control except it has this ability.

Untapped creatures can't block.
Tapped creatures can block.
Creatures assign combat damage equal to their toughness rather than their power.
Lethal damage dealt to creatures is determined by their power rather than their toughness.

{1}{B}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

Whenever a creature you control dies, you may put it on top of its owner's library.

Target creature you control gains haste and menace until end of turn. At the beginning of your next end step, if one or more +1/+1 counters were placed on that creature this turn, return Blind Rage from your graveyard to your hand.

When this enchantment enters, it deals 3 damage to any non-player target.
Whenever you cast a spell, if you paid an additional cost to cast it, exile the top card of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play that card.

Defender
[i]Lorecraft[/i] — As long as you control three or more enchantments, this creature can attack as though it didn't have defender.
Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a cursed player, draw a card.

Enchant player
When this Curse enters, return up to one target creature enchanted player controls to its owner's hand.
Whenever a player other than enchanted player casts a spell, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn and only during enchanted player's turn.

Affinity for Curses [i](This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Curse you control.)[/i]
When Ulgleyth enters or attacks, each opponent loses 2 life.
Whenever Ulgleyth attacks, for each cursed opponent he isn't attacking, create a token copy of him that isn't legendary. It enters tapped and attacking that player. Exile those tokens at the end of combat.

Return target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard to the battlefield under your control. A creature returned to the battlefield this way becomes a black Horror in addition to its other colors and types. Exile this spell.

{G}{W}{U} ENCHANTRESS Cast enchantment spells and get bonuses for casting them.
[/b]{W}{U}{B} MAGE SUPREMACY Druid, Shaman, Warlock, and Wizard creatures power your spellcasting. [i](Druids, Shaman, Warlocks, and Wizards are mages.)[/i]
{U}{B}{R} CURSE YOU! Curses are back. Pile them onto your opponents. While they suffer under their weight, gain the advantage.
{B}{R}{G} ASHEN MONSTROSITY Monstrosity returns. Many creatures gain new effects and abilities when you invest mana.
{R}{G}{W} STRAIN These spells offer extra power for a hefty price. Use other sources of mana production to bypass the downsides.
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G} FABLES New Saga cards with the fable let you choose which chapter to trigger regardless of the order it appears on the card. Careful though, you can still only trigger each chapter once.
